alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 22 at 7:23PM MDT until October 23 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS WILL PRODUCE ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER AGAIN SUNDAY... .A cold front will move across eastern Colorado on Sunday. Southwest winds will gust up to 60 mph in the morning in areas south of Denver and Akron. The winds will shift to the northwest with cooling temperatures in the afternoon. The worst conditions will be in the middle of the day when humidities will be lowest. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL AND NORTHEASTERN COLORADO INCLUDING FIRE WEATHER ZONES 241, 245 THROUGH 247, AND 249... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 241, 245, 246, 247 and 249. * Timing...11 AM Sunday morning until 7 PM MDT Sunday evening. * Winds...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent. * Impacts...There is high potential for rapid fire spread and extreme fire behavior.
info.instruction: Avoid open burning or outdoor activities that could create a spark.
